column4: Hi, I have a laptop running Xubuntu 8.04 32bit and a desktop running Ubuntu 8.04 64bit on a LAN, how can I transfer files between them?
samba is probably the simplest
if you have ssh set up you can type ctrl+l in the file browser and enter ssh://<ip of other machine>/
isn't there something similar to the windows network?
samba, smb://<computer>
<computer> is the local ip of that machine yes?
Either local IP or samba hostname.
is there a way to have the machine as a network icon or something, without having to go through file-browser and smb?
You should be able to browse network machines with Places -> Network
I tried but I was unable....
do I need to set any permissions to do that?
Don't think so, but as soon as you type smb://<computer> it should appear as an icon on your desktop.
I did smb://local.ip and it is asking me for a password? what will that be ?
Try blank password
I tried the password i use to log in to that machine but it doesnt
blank pw doesnt work..
If the user names on the two machines are different, try smb://<username>@<ip> instead
i specified the name but nothing, using or not a password
samba uses its own set of passwords, try typing 'smbpasswd' on the target computer.
no smbpasswd doesnt work
error message?
Couldn't display "smb://192.168.1.8/"
Error: Failed to retrieve share list from server
I installed samba, and using smb://local.ip opens up a folder which is empty, why I cannot see any other folders, the mouth point set up on the box was the user folder
